org.efaps.db.databases

Class MySQLDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.db.databases.AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
      • org.efaps.db.databases.MySQLDatabase

  • public class MySQLDatabase
extends AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
    Database class for the MySQL database.

    $Id$

      • deleteAll

        public void deleteAll(Connection _con)
               throws SQLException

        This is the MySQL specific implementation of an all deletion. Following order is used to remove all eFaps specific information:

        • remove all views of the user
        • remove all tables of the user
        • remove all sequences of the user

        The table are dropped with cascade, so all depending sequences etc. are also dropped automatically.

        Attention! If application specific tables, views or constraints are defined, this database objects are also removed!

        Specified by:
        deleteAll in class AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - sql connection
        Throws:
        SQLException - on error while executing sql statements

      • createTable

        public MySQLDatabase createTable(Connection _con,
                        String _table)
                          throws SQLException
        For the MySQL database, an eFaps SQL table is created in this steps.
        • SQL table itself with column ID and unique key on the column is created
        • if the table is an auto increment table (parent table is null, the column ID is set as auto increment column
        • if no parent table is defined, the foreign key to the parent table is automatically set
        Specified by:
        createTable in class AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - Connection to be used for the SQL statements
        _table - name for the table
        Returns:
        this MySQL DB definition instance
        Throws:
        SQLException - if the table could not be created
        See Also:
        org.efaps.db.databases.AbstractDatabase#createTable(java.sql.Connection, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • createSequence

        public MySQLDatabase createSequence(Connection _con,
                           String _name,
                           long _startValue)
                             throws SQLException
        Creates a table with auto generated keys with table name as concatenation of the prefix PREFIX_SEQUENCE and the lower case of _name. This table "simulates" the sequences (which are not supported by MySQL).
        Specified by:
        createSequence in class AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _name - name of the sequence
        _startValue - start value of the sequence number
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        SQLException - if SQL table could not be created; defined as auto increment table or if the sequence number could not be defined
        See Also:
        createTable(Connection, String), defineTableAutoIncrement(Connection, String), setSequence(Connection, String, long), PREFIX_SEQUENCE

      • deleteSequence

        public MySQLDatabase deleteSequence(Connection _con,
                           String _name)
                             throws SQLException
        Deletes given sequence _name which is internally represented by this MySQL connector as normal SQL table. The name of the SQL table to delete is a concatenation of PREFIX_SEQUENCE and _name in lower case.
        Specified by:
        deleteSequence in class AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _name - name of the sequence
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        SQLException - if sequence (simulated by an auto increment SQL table) could not be deleted
        See Also:
        PREFIX_SEQUENCE

      • existsSequence

        public boolean existsSequence(Connection _con,
                     String _name)
                       throws SQLException
        Checks if the related table representing sequence _name exists.
        Specified by:
        existsSequence in class AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _name - name of the sequence
        Returns:
        true if a table with name as concatenation of PREFIX_SEQUENCE and _name (in lower case) representing the sequence exists; otherwise false
        Throws:
        SQLException - if check for the existence of the table representing the sequence failed
        See Also:
        AbstractDatabase.existsTable(Connection, String), PREFIX_SEQUENCE

      • nextSequence

        public long nextSequence(Connection _con,
                String _name)
                  throws SQLException
        Fetches next number for sequence _name by inserting new row into representing table. The new auto generated key is returned as next number of the sequence.
        Specified by:
        nextSequence in class AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _name - name of the sequence
        Returns:
        current inserted value of the table
        Throws:
        SQLException - if next number from the sequence could not be fetched
        See Also:
        PREFIX_SEQUENCE

      • setSequence

        public MySQLDatabase setSequence(Connection _con,
                        String _name,
                        long _value)
                          throws SQLException
        Defines new _value for sequence _name. Because in MySQL the sequences are simulated and the values from fetched sequence numbers are not deleted, all existing values in the table are first deleted (to be sure that the sequence could be reseted to already fetched numbers). After the new starting value is defined a first auto generated value is fetched from the database so that this value is also stored if the MySQL database is restarted.
        Specified by:
        setSequence in class AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _name - name of the sequence
        _value - new value of the sequence
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        SQLException - if new number of the sequence could not be defined for the table
        See Also:
        PREFIX_SEQUENCE

        public String getHibernateDialect()
        Get the Dialect to access the DataBase using Hibernate.

      • initTableInfoUniqueKeys

        protected void initTableInfoUniqueKeys(Connection _con,
                           String _sql,
                           Map<String,TableInformation> _cache4Name)
                                throws SQLException
        Overwrites the original method to specify SQL statement SQL_UNIQUE_KEYS as replacement because the JDBC driver for MySQL does not handle matching table names.
        Overrides:
        initTableInfoUniqueKeys in class AbstractDatabase<MySQLDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _sql - SQL statement (not used)
        _cache4Name - map used to fetch depending on the table name the related table information
        Throws:
        SQLException - if unique keys could not be fetched
        See Also:
        SQL_UNIQUE_KEYS
